intro: Homalanthus stillingifolius, commonly known as the Hawaiian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is considered an important component of Hawaii's native flora.
